import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; class Lesson_1 extends Component { render() { return (
Chapter 2: Contracts

Starting with the absolute basics:

A contract is the fundamental building block of Ethereum applications â€” all variables and functions belong to a contract, and this will be the starting point of all your projects.

Contracts in Vyper are contained within files, with each file being one smart-contract. Files in Vyper are similar to classes in object-oriented languages.

Unlike in Solidity, Vyper contracts does not have a pragma version. You also don't have to declare a contract object because the whole file is the contract.

Start making the contract
To start creating your Viper, let's create the contract.

1. In the editor in the right, add a comment on the very first line. The comment should contain the name of the contract and the description. This would help other users to easily understand your code.

When you're finished, click "check answer".
